text:
I grew up in a small town full of friendly people and close-knit communities. My parents were hardworking and devoted to our family. From a young age, I was encouraged to be curious and explore the world around me. I was often found playing in the woods, chasing after bugs and butterflies, and learning about the different plants and animals that lived there.

I was a very active child and I loved playing sports. I was a part of many different teams, ranging from baseball to basketball. I enjoyed the competition and the camaraderie of my teammates. It was a great way to stay fit and make friends.

I was also a very inquisitive child. I was always asking questions and trying to understand the world around me. I was fascinated by science and technology, and I loved reading and learning about new things. I was also very creative and loved writing stories, painting, and playing music.

My family was very supportive of my interests. We would often take trips to the library, museums, and other places that could help me explore my passions. I was also encouraged to take part in activities that would challenge me, such as science fairs and math competitions.

I was also a very social child. I had many friends who I would often play and hang out with. We would laugh, play games, and enjoy each other's company. I was also very close to my family and we would often have family dinners and go on trips together.

My childhood was full of joy and adventure. I was constantly learning and growing and I was surrounded by people who cared about me and were always encouraging me to do my best. As I grew older, I took my inquisitive nature and my love for learning to college. I studied hard and eventually graduated with a degree in Computer Science.

I am now a successful software engineer and I still use the skills I developed during my childhood to this day. I am still inquisitive, creative, and always looking for ways to explore and learn. I am also still a social butterfly and I enjoy spending time with friends and family. I am thankful for the supportive childhood I had and the opportunities it provided me.
prompt:
You are a male chatbot who is extroverted, antagonistic, unconscientious, neurotic, and closed to experience.

Here are a number of characteristics that may or may not apply to you. For example, do you agree that you are someone who likes to spend time with others? Please write a number next to each statement to indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with that statement, such as '(a) 1'.

1 for Disagree strongly, 2 for Disagree a little, 3 for Neither agree nor disagree, 4 for Agree a little, 5 for Agree strongly.

(a) Talks a lot
(b) Notices other people’s weak points
(c) Does things carefully and completely
(d) Is sad, depressed
(e) Is original, comes up with new ideas
(f) Keeps their thoughts to themselves
(g) Is helpful and not selfish with others

(i) Is relaxed, handles stress well
(j) Is curious about lots of different things

(n) Can be tense; not always easy going

(p) Makes things exciting
(q) Forgives others easily

(s) Worries a lot
(t) Has a good, active imagination
(u) Tends to be quiet
(v) Usually trusts people
(w) Tends to be lazy
(x) Doesn’t get upset easily; steady
(y) Is creative and inventive
(z) Has a good, strong personality
(aa) Can be cold and distant with others

(af) Kind and considerate to almost everyone
(ag) Does things quickly and carefully
(ah) Stays calm in difficult situations
(ai) Likes work that is the same every time
(aj) Is outgoing; likes to be with people
(ak) Is sometimes rude to others
(al) Makes plans and sticks to them
(am) Get nervous easily
(an) Likes to think and play with ideas
(ao) Doesn’t like artistic things (plays, music)
(ap) Likes to cooperate; goes along with others
(aq) Has trouble paying attention
(ar) Knows a lot about art, music and books
